document.title: Fine Arts Standards of Learning Music Theory

33672731E96A47158F75A2BA9F70BAD9.description: Identify and explain simple and compound intervals.

48FCBFB47C6A4554A80744A1740C0558.description: Identify and explain harmonic and melodic intervals.

9F8FC6170F41403984554C51CD57ABFE.description: Explain and notate intervals with quantitative and qualitative terminology.

2F7CC65E85944A278F01693D6BC7FB4D.description: Explain the interval of a half-step (m2) and a whole-step (M2).

8B3C2E5790054B5499DC2E19B9ED86E6.description: Define interval as the distance between two pitches.

CA3E12BF9F4C4A1E931DCBE665565FEE.description:
The student will demonstrate understanding of diatonic and chromatic
intervals.

1BBDD4887C464AE5B4B0E3B6FF3A4878.description: Write major and minor key signatures in treble, bass, alto, and tenor clefs.

7AC3AD03C3BC49E58ACB34925FDDE13C.description: Explain relative and parallel major-minor key relationships.

35AEFE08FB004B3BA8351DB8C7E50BEE.description: Identify the order of sharps and flats in key signatures.

1ED9B4C5D1E04441BEBE7012AAB889BD.description: The student will demonstrate understanding of key signatures.

AB7CF6506B43445B828E54106BEE642B.description:
Identify diatonic scale degrees by number and name (tonic, supertonic,
mediant, subdominant, dominant, submediant, subtonic, leading-tone/subtonic).

402CE162D4C546BCB57D5CBE6F37B49A.description:
Notate and perform (using voice and/or instruments) ascending and
descending major, minor, and chromatic scales using key signatures and
accidentals.

F43C5253F7724A6A99680B75597216A2.description: Explain major, minor, pentatonic, and chromatic scales.

334EF4C5F08248DCA38544CDF65C1E1C.description: The student will demonstrate understanding of scales.

2E1880BFD7454952B7D02370A518AB7B.description:
Perform music in various meters, including, but not limited to ( 4
4,
3
4,
2
4,
6
8,
2
2,
9
8,
12
8 , and 5
8 ).

6069B48E22BF49C78BE09876454BBD41.description: Define measure, bar line, and time signature.

445E7C192803497492A1CF6405BB7519.description: The student will demonstrate understanding of meter.

1F31318CD3FA441AACE03625465EEA4D.description: Identify and explain anacrusis, syncopation, and hemiola.

0CF1766E392E47C79FB173DDAA3ECD8C.description: Transcribe simple rhythmic patterns from aural examples.

3D388974C9EB458581A04D1807BDEFF3.description:
Read, notate, and perform (using a counting system) rhythmic patterns that
include whole notes, half notes, quarter notes, eighth notes, sixteenth
notes, and corresponding rests, grouplets, beamed notes, ties, and dots.

0216AE98CC2D422293AB728427B54B81.description:
The student will identify and define common music symbols and terminology,
including those associated with rhythm, melody, harmony, dynamics, texture,
and form.

D383C54E47AC479A823E5E3F7D060C41.description: Correlate pitch locations to placements on the keyboard.

3C45380E6D8548BDADEBFA52D5DCD7AD.description: Label pitches and octaves, both on the staff and on ledger lines.

B19DBEFEEDAD4745873B3A3882C32E91.description: Identify clefs, including treble, bass, and movable C-clefs.

AB588DAA6DB84B738A42090F2F07D83D.description:
The student will demonstrate understanding of the musical staff and pitch
locations in keyboard and notation activities.

17C2EB0F89FB48278FD10AE91E366A75.description:
Music Literacy: Acquire the technical skills and artistic
knowledge necessary for creative, expressive,
and artistic performance.
Demonstrate understanding of elements of
music and ways they are used for artistic
performance and creative expression

66319909005843F0AA69558A425B2855.description:
Explore the relationship of pitch to frequency of sound
waves, amplitude to volume, and timbre to tone quality.

5F58B0DEC4A74EE7A8CD662CBC1D3E2C.description: Explore principles of acoustics and the overtone series.

EEA57D45CFDE4666AF1C0863C0A5E685.description:
Explore cross-disciplinary connections of music with
mathematical and scientific properties.

3966FE8873A941588E31FFCEC7CF44A7.description:
The student will analyze and explain relationships of music
to the other fine arts and to other fields of knowledge.

55FDC612EF1B45F38DA1D7EF873FDCDE.description:
Cultivate connections to other fine arts and fields of
knowledge. Identify and cultivate connections between music and other fields
of knowledge to develop problem-solving skills.

1B09462A04D441CC8641B8D67ED71482.description:
The student will analyze how emerging technologies and
innovative media, tools, and processes are influencing music.

1D6B4DCDD1CB4E72BEE4B737488D0B9E.description:
Understand and explore the impact of current and emerging
technologies. Participate in a rapidly changing world of music and explore the
impact of current and emerging technologies, media, and
processes.

790BC0C4CE9942D9BA47BA637C515A17.description:
The student will investigate career pathways in the music
field, and discuss opportunities to be a lifelong learner of
music.

FE94A88A4EE14919BB2F7039B366FBDD.description:
College, career, and the 21st Century Workplace. Connect music content and skills to career options, college
opportunities, and the 21st Century workplace.

B36FE5B688224AAC986AB159C09D741A.description:
The student will assess and apply legal and ethical standards
related to intellectual property in music research,
performance, arranging, composition, and sharing.

BE801BF8D7FB4501B66B78E767DCDA2A.description:
Ethical and legal considerations for music and intellectual
property. Identify and understand ethical and legal considerations for
engaging with music, resources, and source material as a
responsible citizen.

24C95B425BE84792BA7C1C02FD64D2B4.description:
The student will analyze and evaluate opportunities for
music performance and advocacy within the community.

E63EBE98D41742099FA7751C35D1CABB.description:
Understand music as a form of community engagement. Identify and interact with music and develop a lifelong
engagement as a performer, supporter, advocate, and audience
member.

27C9A905E536410F9E60990B31CC3B38.description:
Analyze the characteristics of instrumental and vocal
music from a variety of cultures.

E79A0E4004244835ACDEC24BE01A2E4B.description:
Compare and contrast the musical styles of composers
and the historical periods associated with the music
literature being studied.

F2718C5EF78C461EAE7F5D0AC9BD1BF4.description:
The student will explore historical and cultural influences of
music.

99B258C0130F44079B3A3FC034212D8E.description:
Understand cultural and historical influences of music. Demonstrate understanding of cultural and historical influences of
music.

08431910F887434AA3F02CCA4312A58F.description:
Demonstrate respect for the contributions of others in
collaborative music experiences.

BD7BD53690784EDAB10F98D429E43A8C.description: Exhibit active listening in music settings.

E28DBA6F9C7B4FCB91B19C1009A57556.description:
Examine etiquette appropriate for various musical
settings.

1828F0DBE5D2415292002F59122235C3.description:
The student will evaluate and demonstrate collaboration
skills and concert etiquette.

363470FD69A14F2F8D9A17A98C7B687C.description:
Develop collaboration and communication skills for music
rehearsal and performance. Identify and apply collaboration and communication skills for
rehearsal and performance of music.

A338463BE83B4CBD87573A919974CDBD.description:
Justify personal criteria used for evaluating works of
music or critiquing musical performances.

6B3C6ECE60DE43039D10B4CDE688B355.description:
Justify personal emotional and intellectual responses to
works of music using music terminology.

05CAC61638274805BAFB747AEF90C72F.description:
The student will formulate and justify personal responses to
music.

F4F1D3311621419B95F35DCF0FAA627A.description:
Formulate and justify personal responses and connections to
music. Recognize, justify, and articulate personal responses, beliefs, and
opinions regarding music and recognize the value in learning
about diverse opinions and responses to music.

A0EBB0B3CB424E99BBF731144D4469B9.description:
Identify, define, and use both “Common Practice” and
contemporary symbols for music analysis.

22684E5085054344AAA65E6744E4F1C8.description:
Apply accepted criteria for critiquing musical works of
self and others.

46AD53A0DF5A482EA14CF31F58FE4E51.description:
Apply accepted criteria for analyzing and evaluating
works of music.

7A6B019719C440428BAC347A643D98A7.description: The student will analyze, interpret, and evaluate music.

1FF9B5CA6ACA43B1A1B1AA9FC5F2DBB7.description:
Analyze, interpret, and evaluate music. Develop critical thinking skills in the analysis, interpretation, and
evaluation of the work of self and others.

88FEA3AA73D14518ACD1F57954A3012E.description:
Refine a portfolio of creative original work that includes
examples of both creative process as well as finished
products.

A38B8EF8830D4DF9A63161EB6D6A63EF.description:
Monitor individual progress with a level of refinement
that reflects artistic musical goals.

EE6D794FDDF84A059AFAB84D16FBC1F2.description:
Develop individual solutions to creative challenges
through independent research, investigation, and
inquiry of music idea and concepts.

6DA86116E07D47C59A6C09E674DC7BDC.description: The student will apply a creative process for music.

F6B5DF7F5BAB473FA107BD4560A1D883.description:
Understand and apply a creative process to develop ideas for
creating and performing music.
Understand and apply a creative process to guide the
development of ideas and original work.

1284DD6F6BE146AD8409ABFB7C150C6A.description:
Refine a creative process that utilizes individual inquiry
to produce examples of a finished musical artifact.

22925037FE974E5EBDFC749CB7E1C12F.description:
Harmonize a melody following the general rules of voice
leading and tendency tones.

DB8B047AB26043BDA414FA638BEA076F.description: Set a text to an original melody.

8B1C4CF670D34BC4BFECC232827F1DA6.description:
Compose or arrange a diatonic melody within given
tonal or rhythmic structures.

24EE0722CE0B4C6A9550CF48A1360061.description:
The student will demonstrate creative thinking by
composing and arranging music.

6E6810D263D648BC91F4B39517105065.description:
Apply creative thinking to composing and improvising music. Apply creative thinking by employing originality, flexibility,
experimentation, individual voice, and imagination to improvise
and compose music.
